context: The word 'pidin' is the first person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'pidama', which means 'to have to', 'must', or 'to be obliged'. It indicates an obligation or necessity in the past. The root 'pid-' can also appear in other forms like 'pidunud' (obliged/had to), 'peaksin' (should), and 'pidaksin' (would have to).
